data.name: A Voice for a Life
entries: {@i You've given a cat your voice to sing in exchange for one of its lives.}

Whenever you would be reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can choose to lose this Story Record and instead drop to 1 Hit Points and gain 40 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} which last for 1 minute.
While you have this Story Record, you have the {@reward Cat got your tongue?|WM4} Curse,
{@note Made by Gem}

data.name: ASYS Trial Participant
entries: You have participated in an ASYS Corporation lab trial, contributing to the research of magic. Thank you for your efforts towards the betterment of society.
{@note Made by Christopher}

data.name: Arms Dealer Dealer
entries: You’ve earned the respect of Castil, premier gunsmith of Westgate. He offers a small discount at his shop, access to more select merchandise, and more jobs when he has them.
{@note Made by Lily}

data.name: Bought a Trip to Wildspace
entries: You bought a trip to Wildspace! Nice.
{@note Made by Landon}

data.name: Demon Spawn
entries: For whatever benign reason, you have been transformed into a creature that carries the essence of evil itself. The traits gained from your species are replaced with the following:

items: {@b Creature Type:} Your creature type is Fiend (Demon).
{@b Abyssal Fortitude:} You are Resistant to Cold, Fire, and Lightning Damage.
{@b Alignment:} Your alignment is Chaotic Evil.

{@b Abyssal Corruption:} You gain a randomly determined flaw from the {@table Optional Rule: Abyssal Corruption; Abyssal Corruption|DMG|Abyssal Corruption table}, ignoring rolls of 10. You yearn for the Abyss; while not in the Abyss, you have a -1 to all {@variantrule D20 test|XPHB|D20 tests}.

entries: {@note Made by Chrys}

data.name: Dingy Hospitality
entries: You have the protection of Balabar Smenk, an upstart criminal from Westgate. When in Westgate, you can find a place to hide, rest, or recuperate within the criminal network, unless you have shown yourself to be a danger to those who are sheltering you. They will shield you from the law or anyone else searching for you, though they will not risk their lives for you.
{@note Made by Chrys}

data.name: Efreeti's Serf
entries: {@i Your soul is binded to an {@creature Efreeti|XMM} in order to do its whims.}
You are {@condition Charmed} by that {@creature Efreeti|XMM}. They have a telepathic link with you.
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, that {@creature Efreeti|XMM} can deal {@dice 5d10} Fire damage to you. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.
When you deal Fire damage to a creature, you can have that creature start burning. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

data.name: Grand Theft Westgate
entries: You took part in a high profile burglary in Westgate, which resulted in multiple deaths. Local authorities are on the lookout for you, making you no longer welcome in the city.
If you take the Visit Westgate bastion turn, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1 you are found by authorities and arrested.
{@note Made by Andrew}

data.name: Greased Hog Lightning
entries: The Hoggler is known throughout Raven's Bluff to have killed a goblin under the Crossed Quils' House while covered in Grease. Local legends are formed around this event.
{@note Made by Patrick}

data.name: Honorary Hatter
entries: You’ve passed the Trial of Hats and garnered Maddison Milner’s respect.
{@note Made by Marvin}

data.name: Known by its Embrace
entries: {@i Without me, you are nothing. In my arms, you are everything. To bleed is to feel. To feel is to see. To see is to know. To know is to love.}
{@i Expect to know its embrace once again.}
{@note Made by Althaea}

data.name: Legendary Importance
entries: You are considered to be of legendary importance for the purposes of the {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB} spell.
{@note Made by Aris}

data.name: Marketable Plushie
entries: {@i You've managed to give up your merch rights.}
You have allowed a creature to sell merch of your likeness. You occasionally find it for sale when shopping.
{@note Made by Gem}

data.name: Return to Love
entries: You have traded a language with "yourself"
You can speak and understand Sylvan. In return, you can no longer speak or write Common but still understand it.
{@note Made by Gem}

data.name: SEAF Recruit
entries: You’ve successfully finished a dive with the SEAF. You’ve earned a small modicum of their trust, and contributed to Managed Democracy.
{@note Made by Lily}

data.name: Savage Creature
entries: {@i Prerequisite: Aberration, Beast, Dragon, Fey, Giant, Humanoid, or Monstrosity.}

entries.name: Savage Frenzy.
entries: You are Chaotic Evil. You are {@variantrule Hostile [Attitude]|XPHB|Hostile} to all creatures that lack this Story Record and that aren't Demons. In addition, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Strength and Constitution {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}, and {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Intelligence and Charisma {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests}.

entries.name: AC.
entries: Your AC while not wearing armor is increased by 1

entries.name: Speed.
entries: Your walking {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is increased by 10 feet.

entries.name: Darkvision.
entries: You gain {@sense Darkvision} of 60 feet.

entries.name: Resistance to Acid.
entries: You are {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistant} to Acid damage.

entries.name: Tireless.
entries: You are immune to {@condition Exhaustion}, {@condition Stunned}, Magical Contagions, and the {@condition Charmed} condition.

entries.name: Bite.
entries: You gain a natural weapon with which you can make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. On a hit, it deals {@dice 1d8} Piercing damage.

Those you bite must make a Constitution saving throw (DC is 8 + your Constitution modifier + your Proficiency Bonus). On a failure, the target contracts a Magical Contagion called {@condition Savage Fever|WM4}.

entries.name: Death Throes.
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB} with your bite against a creature within reach before you die.

When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you die, and your body melts into a puddle of goo, leaving only your gear and your skeleton, if any. All creatures within a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} of you must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} Acid damage. A pool of acid remains on the ground in your former space, and any creature that enters the space takes {@dice 1d6} Acid damage. After 1 minute, the puddle dries up into a harmless green powder.

entries.name: Removing the Story Record.
entries: This story record and the transformations wrought by it are removed by a {@spell Greater Restoration|XPHB} or {@spell Wish|XPHB} spell. They can also be removed by killing the creature and then bringing it back to life.
{@note Made by Aris, from Dragon 140

data.name: Saved Up Enough To Finally Go to Wildspace
entries: If you have 10,000 gp, you can spend that much gp and a Bastion Turn to take a vacation to Wildspace. You receive a {@item Fish Suit|AAG} as a souvenir and this Story Record is replaced with {@reward Bought a Trip to Wildspace|WM4}.
{@note Made by Landon}

data.name: Spire of Sasserine
entries: A medal awarded to those who perform great services to the city of Sasserine. You have a +5 bonus to Charisma ({@skill Persuasion} or {@skill Investigation}) checks made in Sasserine.
{@note Made by Aris, from Dragon 139}

data.name: Starmantle's Gratitude
entries: You've extinguished the inferno and felled the first Machine. As such, you have the deepest thanks of Starmantle's people.
{@note Made by Christopher}

data.name: The Gift of Lolth
entries: Your magic now relies on the Demon Weave, instead of the Weave.
{@note Made by Aris}

data.name: Vow of Kindness to Beasts
entries: You have promised to never harm a beast.
You have a +1 to Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks. If you ever willingly harm a beast except in self-defense, you instead have a -5 penalty to Wisdom ({@skill Animal Handling}) checks.
{@note Made by Landon}

data.name: WSS Membership Card
entries: With this card, you are considered an honorary member of the Westgate Sanitary Society (AKA the Rat Bastards). While this doesn't do much, members of the Rat Bastards will respect you a bit more than usual.
{@note Made by Sam}

data.name: [LOS] Breaker of Silence
entries: You've felled the third Machine, destroyed the Mass Shadow Engine, and returned both light and water to the streets of Perago.
{@note Made by Christopher}

data.name: [LOS] Colossus Crusher
entries: You carry the renown of stopping the second Machine's rampage. The people of the Northern regions will speak of your great deed for many years.
{@note Made by Christopher}

data.name: [LOS] Midnight Alliance
entries: In a fervent night of poison, lies, and illusion, you claimed victory over the fifth Machine. In doing so, you have not only thwarted the plans of life's enemy, but earned valuable allies in both Talia and Raul.
{@note Made by Christopher}

data.name: [LOS] Oceanic Conqueror
entries: You've ventured into the heart of the tempest and defeated the fourth Machine. The souls of the lost at sea can know peace, and the Westmarch castle is safe from destruction...well, from this particular opponent, at least.
{@note Made by Christopher}

data.name: [LOS] Starmantle's Gratitude
entries: You've extinguished the inferno and felled the first Machine. As such, you have the deepest thanks of Starmantle's people.
{@note Made by Christopher}

data.name: [SEC] Dungeoneer
entries: You have become an official member of the Scholar Exploration Corps and are able to go on expeditions with them.

Whenever you take the Guildhall: Dungeoneer bastion turn, you can choose to go on an expedition with SEC. If you do so, roll on the list twice and pick one of the items you rolled to receive (Rerolling duplicates).
{@note Made by Gem}

data.name: [SMP] Banned for Life
entries: You have committed a dastardly crime against The Scholars of Millenniums Past, and have been banned from their libraries permanently. If you are found out to be banned while trespassing onto their property, hostile action will be taken. While other libraries don't immediately take this as proof of bad book lending, many will be hesitant to let you visit.
{@note Made by Gem}

data.name: [SMP] Card Holder
entries: You have been recognized as responsible enough to check out books from any Scholars of Millenniums Past' library. As a highly prestigious library organization, many non-associated libraries accept this membership as well.
{@note Made by Gem}

data.name: [SMP] Scholar
entries: Due to your dedication or assistance to The Scholars of Millenniums Past, you have shown yourself to be trustworthy. You receive preferential treatment over simple Card Holders. Additionally, you are allowed to start your own library under their name, and they will provide aid to do such.
{@note Made by Gem}
